content: I know, I have already realized that you are me and I am you, so we are both screwed. I never dared, Cassiopeia, but now the end is knocking often at the door of my mind, more than I could ever imagine. I tried to look at you, but you turned your head and remained silent. I expected you to at least say “yes” or “no” as you are supposed to, but everything you do sounds like a “I don’t know” which is way worse for me. It keeps me dead. While society spins, skyscrapers grow, people walk, run, hold one another, kiss, I stand still like ice.
